body:
I can confirm this problem.  There is logic to skip deletes on dry run, but the `--dry-run` flag setting isn't being passed down to it for some reason that I'll work out shortly!

Thanks for the bug report.
I've made a new release with this fix v0.99 - thanks for reporting the problem!

issue.title: Rclone fails randomly

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
Hello,

I'm running rclone v1.30 on 64 bit debian wheezy. trying to sync data from nfs mount to s3

Command i used is ./rclone sync --checkers 100 --transfers 30 /import/xxx/yyyy/ xxx-remote:backup

i generated core dump and here is bt full:
(gdb) bt full
#0  0x0000000000462554 in ?? ()

No symbol table info available.
#1  0x00000000004432a8 in ?? ()

No symbol table info available.
#2  0x0000000000000006 in ?? ()

No symbol table info available.
#3  0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()

No symbol table info available.

nfs has ~55TB of data and most of that is already on s3(via snowball). i just wanted to sync differences. sync sometimes fails after 2G transferred and sometimes after 15T transferred. 

If needed i can attach whole traceback from rclone fail, start of it:
unexpected fault address 0x0
fatal error: fault
[signal 0xb code=0x80 addr=0x0 pc=0x410d16]

goroutine 1 [running]:
runtime.throw(0xc11e58, 0x5)

runtime.sigpanic()

runtime.mapaccess2_faststr(0x9c6d20, 0xc82044f5c0, 0xc9ce1c29c0, 0x59, 0xcb7dd3fae8, 0xca0837b901)
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/hashmap_fast.go:382 +0x476 fp=0xc8206c7a98 sp=0xc8206c7a38
github.com/ncw/rclone/fs.syncCopyMove(0x7fca1448df70, 0xc8201988c0, 0x7fca1448dd90, 0xc82015a690, 0x430001, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/ncw/Code/Go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/fs/operations.go:639 +0x632 fp=0xc8206c7c30 sp=0xc8206c7a98
github.com/ncw/rclone/fs.Sync(0x7fca1448df70, 0xc8201988c0, 0x7fca1448dd90, 0xc82015a690, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/ncw/Code/Go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/fs/operations.go:669 +0x61 fp=0xc8206c7c80 sp=0xc8206c7c30
main.glob.func2(0x7fca1448df70, 0xc8201988c0, 0x7fca1448dd90, 0xc82015a690, 0x0, 0x0)
        /home/ncw/Code/Go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/rclone.go:83 +0x4b fp=0xc8206c7cb8 sp=0xc8206c7c80
main.main()
        /home/ncw/Code/Go/src/github.com/ncw/rclone/rclone.go:486 +0xc04 fp=0xc8206c7f50 sp=0xc8206c7cb8
runtime.main()
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/proc.go:188 +0x2b0 fp=0xc8206c7fa0 sp=0xc8206c7f50
runtime.goexit()
        /usr/local/go/src/runtime/asm_amd64.s:1998 +0x1 fp=0xc8206c7fa8 sp=0xc8206c7fa0

thanks!

issue.title: Google Drive (encrypted): "failed to authenticate decrypted block - bad password?" on files during reading

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone 1.35

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Devuan Linux 1.0 (systemd-free fork of Debian Jessie).

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive, with the built-in rclone encryption.

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

`rclone -v --dump-headers --log-file=LOGFILE copy egd:REDACTED/REDACTED/REDACTED/REDACTED.mp4 /tmp/REDACTED.mp4
`
 

> A log from the command with the `-v` flag (eg output from `rclone -v copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

Please find it attached: [LOGFILE.txt](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/files/691515/LOGFILE.txt)

Note 1: This is related to #677, which is closed and I cannot reopen.
Note 2: These errors are 100% reproducible.

Cheers, 
   Durval.

issue.title: rClone - Cache problem / Windows / Linux

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
> What is your rclone version (eg output from `rclone -V`)

rclone v1.39
os/arch: windows/amd64
go version: go1.9.2

> Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)

Windows 10, 64bit

> Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)

Google Drive

> The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)

rclone -v mount --allow-non-empty --allow-other --max-read-ahead 200M --drive-chunk-size 128M --checkers 40 --dir-cache-time 30m --transfers=32 google1: /cloud_drive/googlestorage1 &

```
2018/01/24 03:42:28 ERROR : winfsp-1.2.17346.msi: WriteFileHandle: Truncate: Can't change size without cache
2018/01/24 03:42:38 ERROR : winfsp-1.2.17346.msi: WriteFileHandle: ReadAt: Can't read and write to file without cache 
```

I had 3 different problems at the moment. 1 is already solved. 

I think the main problem is the cache option on my systems. On Windows i get always the errors your can see above. 

The second problem is when i stream from my root server i can stream with this mount "4k" without anyproblems directly out of my google drive. I started setting up a new server with ubuntu 16.04. and setup rClone, but from this server it is impossible to stream cause the stream is wholte time freezing. I think it is not a hardware problem cause those are dedicated 4 and 8 core servers, i think it is a big cache problem with mounting. 

#1 Informations the main linux system: (all working perfectly including streaming): 
Intel G850
32 GB Ram
8 TB HDD
10 Gbit/s

#2 Informations about second linux system: (streaming not possible, whole files lagging, freezing):
Ubuntu 16.04. -64 Bit
Intel C2750 Avoton - 16 GB RAM and SSD for Hostsystem. 
1 Gbit/s

#3 Informations about my windows system: (Truncate Error with reading/writing files on the drive):
AMD Ryzen1800x
32 GB Ram
M2 SSD
200 MBit/s

Any idea which options i can try for streaming from linux and using my crypted rClone drive over windows for moving files on it ?

Best Regards

issue.title: Make bash completion respect --config.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
The bash completion script may add remotes to the candidates, by running
`rclone listremotes`. However it does not make sense if the current
command is `rclone --config MY_CONFIG_FILE`.

With this commit, the bash completion script will try to extract the
config file, then run `rclone --cofnig MY_CONFIG_FILE listremotes`
instead.

#### What is the purpose of this change?
See above (commit message)

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?
No

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [ ] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

issue.title: Support for symlinks in mount / vfs

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?
Add mount / vfs symlink support

Please, note that it has only been tested with storj backend on linux.
Especially, macOS, windows were not tested.
Please do test those platforms and any other backends !!!

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/issues/2975

#### Checklist
- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [ ] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

#### Notes
The whole work has been (trashed mostly) refactored. They were flaws in the previous implementation, especially trying to use truncated names in the vfs dir internal nodes  names which lead to inconsistency when it comes to push changes to the remotes.
For this reason, the refactoring went in 2 parts:

1. Add symlinks support in the VFS itself, in the form of always storing symlinks with the .rclonelink suffix, those being regular files.
The VFS Readlink and Symlink additions allow support for symlinks, even if the --links command line switch is not enabled, it's just a mater of creating a .rclonelink regular file with the target inside.
The only difference is that when --link is enabled, the VFS nodes Mode() would report the **os.ModeSymlink** flag hint.
This approach limit adding regressions in the VFS itself as there is no more names tweaking.
Some more checks were also added, to avoid to allow creating / moving files / links / directories names that would clash.
By example, the VFS must not be able to create in the same directory  something called **Hello.txt** and something called **Hello.txt.rclonelink**, this is because when using the mount operation with --links enabled, we would end up with both files claiming the same node name: **Hello.txt**.

2.  Add symlinks support in the mount backends, they are required to translate from the full vfs names into truncated names to the end user: **Test.rclonelink** would be seen as **Test**.
When --links command line switch is enabled, the file system will translate any ***.rclonelink** files into * links.
On the other hand, if --links is disabled, the symlinks will be seen as regular files, with their .rclonelink suffix which content contains the target file path.

Those changes comes with a rather big TestSymlinks unit test, which test all possible api and combinations.
The tests are ran for a VFS and each backends, with and without --links command line switch enabled, covering all possible scenarios.

I did run the tests successfully using this bash script:
```
#!/bin/bash -e

# Run the VFS tests in all subdirectories
pushd vfs
go test -tags cmount -v ./...
#go test -tags cmount -v -run TestFunctional
popd

# This test uses the tests in vfs/vfstest
pushd cmd/cmount
go test -tags cmount -v
popd

# This test uses the tests in vfs/vfstest
pushd cmd/mount
go test -v
popd

# This test uses the tests in vfs/vfstest
pushd cmd/mount2
go test -v
popd
```

issue.title: Add FileLu cloud storage backend

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
<!--
Thank you very much for contributing code or documentation to rclone! Please
fill out the following questions to make it easier for us to review your
changes.

You do not need to check all the boxes below all at once, feel free to take
your time and add more commits. If you're done and ready for review, please
check the last box.
-->

This pull request introduces the `FileLu` cloud storage backend to Rclone, allowing users to integrate their FileLu cloud storage with Rclone for seamless file list files, list folders, copy, move, uploads, downloads, sync, and management.

<!--
Key Features:
- Enables uploading, downloading, and managing files on FileLu cloud storage.
- Supports authentication and integration using FileLu RC keys.
- Fully configurable via Rclones command-line interface, offering a variety of operations such as:
  - Listing files (`rclone ls`, `rclone lsd`)
  - Syncing and copying files (`rclone sync`, `rclone copy`)
  - Moving and deleting files (`rclone move`, `rclone delete`)
  - Creating and removing directories (`rclone mkdir`, `rclone rmdir`)
  - Transferring files between FileLu and other remote storage solutions.

Usage:
1. Configure the FileLu backend by adding your FileLu Rclone Key using `rclone config`.
2. Use standard Rclone commands such as:
   - `rclone copy`  to copy files from FileLu to local or remote systems.
   - `rclone sync`  to synchronize files between FileLu and other locations.
   - `rclone ls`  to list files stored on FileLu.
   - `rclone move`  to move files to and from FileLu.
   - `rclone lsd`  to list directories in your FileLu storage.
   - `rclone about`  to check storage usage and capacity for your FileLu account.
   - `rclone mkdir`  to create directories in your FileLu storage.
   - `rclone rmdir`  to remove empty directories from FileLu.
   - `rclone delete`  to delete files or directories from FileLu.
   This backend was added to enhance Rclone's capabilities by supporting FileLu cloud storage, which provides scalable file storage solutions for users.

Please review the code and suggest any improvements. Let me know if you need any further information!
-->

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?
No
<!--
Link issues and relevant forum posts here.
-->

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)
